overview.purpose: Position sizing rules for options to maintain risk parity with equity framework
overview.philosophy: Match equity risk levels but capture leverage benefit. Total portfolio risk unchanged.
overview.integration: Used by open skill to calculate position sizes for options trades

max_premium_at_risk_total.description: Maximum 10% of total portfolio in options premium across all positions

max_notional_exposure.description: Maximum 30% notional exposure (delta-adjusted) across all options
max_notional_exposure.rationale: Total delta exposure should not exceed reasonable equity allocation

max_options_positions.rationale: Options require active monitoring - limit cognitive load
max_options_positions.note: Total positions (equity + options) still capped at 10 from CONFIG.json

max_single_position_premium.description: No single options position > 4% portfolio in premium
max_single_position_premium.rationale: Match largest single equity position (Activist 6% * 2/3 safety margin)

calculation_example.note: Same $375 risk as equity, but 5x notional exposure ($7,500 vs $1,500)

biotech_premium.rationale: Smaller biotechs have binary risk - reduce exposure

tier_1.note: Tier-1 83% success rate justifies larger position

tier_3.note: Tier-3 40% success rate - equity only, no options

leaps_premium.action: LEAPS are expensive - verify breakeven analysis
leaps_premium.note: Don't pay >15% of stock price in premium for LEAPS

calculation_notes.note: Only use options when spread >8% - otherwise equity is better
calculation_notes.target_return: Capture 50-70% of spread via options leverage

narrow_spread.rationale: Less margin for error on narrow spreads

hostile_premium.condition: Deal has regulatory risk or financing contingency
hostile_premium.action: Reduce position by 50% or avoid options entirely
hostile_premium.rationale: Options amplify downside on deal breaks

enhanced_requirements.note: Higher bar than equity (3+ insiders, $250k, score 8.25)

distressed_context.rationale: Distressed insider buys have 70% success rate - higher conviction

spinoff.rationale: No options market in first 60-90 days - use equity only

liquidation.rationale: SPACs near NAV have minimal volatility - options not advantageous

legislative.rationale: Uncertain timelines - theta decay makes options unsuitable

position_sizing_workflow.step_1: Identify archetype and confirm options enabled
position_sizing_workflow.step_2: Calculate base position: contracts = floor(portfolio * max_premium / (option_premium * 100))
position_sizing_workflow.step_3: Apply archetype-specific adjustments (IV, spread, tier, etc.)
position_sizing_workflow.step_4: Calculate notional exposure: notional = contracts * 100 * stock_price * delta
position_sizing_workflow.step_8: If any limit exceeded, reduce position proportionally
position_sizing_workflow.step_9: Round down to whole contracts (never round up)

kellner_rule_adaptation.options_interpretation: Max 2% portfolio in premium at risk per trade
kellner_rule_adaptation.rationale: Options premium is the 'max loss' - this maintains risk parity with equity
kellner_rule_adaptation.note: Archetype caps are LOWER for options to account for theta decay risk

options_adjustment.rationale: Options have theta decay - reduce Kelly fraction across all archetypes

concentration_limits.description: No more than 6% total premium in any single archetype

same_sector.condition: Multiple positions in same sector (e.g., 2+ biotech PDUFA)
same_sector.rationale: Sector events (FDA staffing, policy) create correlation

same_catalyst_date.rationale: FDA often batches decisions - correlation risk

vix_20_30.action: Reduce all new options positions by 25%
vix_20_30.rationale: Elevated volatility = higher option prices, less attractive

vix_above_30.action: Reduce all new options positions by 50%
vix_above_30.rationale: Crisis mode - options extremely expensive, equity preferred

hy_oas_widening.action: Pause all new merger arb options (maintain equity rules)
hy_oas_widening.rationale: Credit stress increases deal break risk

track_portfolio_level.aggregate_theta: Total daily theta decay across all positions

total_premium_approaching_limit.action: Alert: 'Options exposure 8% of portfolio, approaching 10% limit'

high_theta_decay.action: Alert: 'Theta decay exceeds 1% of portfolio per day - review positions'

approaching_expiration.action: Alert: 'Position expiring in <30 days - close or roll soon'

calculation.issue: Can't even buy 1 contract - LEAPS too expensive
calculation.adjustment: Try call debit spread to reduce cost
calculation.note: Expensive stocks often require spreads to fit position sizing

notes: Always round DOWN to whole contracts - never exceed risk limits
Premium at risk is the true 'position size' for options - treat it like equity allocation
Monitor theta decay daily - it's real P&L even if unrealized
Notional exposure caps prevent over-leveraging via cheap options
Regime adjustments apply to options MORE than equity (volatility premium impact)
